rounds.response:
I have A♦ 5♦ on a rainbow flop of 2♥ K♣ 4♦.

Current situation:
- Pot: 160 chips
- Bet: 0
- Stacks: 880 (P0) vs 960 (me) — effective stack depth ≈880
- My equity: Ace-high with a back-door nut flush draw and back-door wheel draw (need 3-6 for gutter).

Flop texture is K-high rainbow (two-tone hearts/clubs/diamonds but no flush draw yet). King smashes villain’s big-blind calling range. Against a float-bet or a delayed c-bet, villain can easily hit or represent this king.

With 160 chips already in, and staying 880 deep, a small-to-medium c-bet is standard to balance value vs bluff. A sizing around 80-100 (half-pot to two-thirds pot) folds out non-king hands and charges draws while protecting certain portions of my range. 80 keeps pot under ½ effective stack for potential turn maneuvering.

[Bet 80]

rounds.response:
[Player 1]  
Turn is 8♠ – another blank that doesn’t change much.  
Board is now 2♥ K♣ 4♦ 8♠ (rainbow with a 1-liner to a wheel).  
I still have A-high, no pair, no flush draw.  
Pot is 320 chips.  
Effective stack behind: 800 chips (P0) and 880 chips (me).

The turn card favors my range as pre-flop aggressor (I can have more 8-kickers and all overpairs to the 8), but villain just defended flop with a call, so their range puts them in a spot to continue with a lot of kings, pocket pairs like 55-QQ, maybe floats like QJ/J10 etc.

A second barrel needs to accomplish one of two things:
1. Force out all hands worse than ace-high.  
2. Set up a river shove on certain run-outs.

However, this turn (blank 8♠) improves very little of my range AND makes betting big/folding turns perilous. Meanwhile, I’m out of position and have a capped/nuttier ratio—while value portion wants to jam–blend, my current bluffing range must tread carefully.

At 320 pot and 800 behind, firing again forces us into awkward pot-size if we get raised, or loses too much value if we check back with ace-high. We might get called by king/ pocket 8/4s. Since we are not facing a bet right now, checking to pot-control and preserve equity in my showdown-wager is very reasonable here. If river is safe (non-k/Ace-7 diamond, non-4) — we go check/ make thin river call based on bet size.  

In short, this isn’t a textbook auto-bluff turn and satisfied enough to control costs with ace-high holdings.

[Check]

In short, this isn’t a textbook auto-bluff turn and satisfied enough to control costs with ace-high holdings.
